place.name: GRANSTON
place.gazetteerText: GRANSTON, a parish in Haverfordwest district, Pembroke; near the coast, 5 miles SW of Fishguard, and 13 NNW of Haverfordwest r. station. Post town, Fishguard, under Haverfordwest. Acres, 1, 639. Real property, £1, 121. Pop., 156. Houses, 31. The living is a vicarage, united with the vicarage of St. Nicholas, in the diocese of St. Davids. Value, £316. Patron, the Bishop of St. Davids. The church contains monuments of the Harrieses. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
